metadata.name: Potential Persistence Via Notepad++ Plugins
metadata.comment: Detects creation of new ".dll" files inside the plugins directory of a notepad++ installation by a process other than "gup.exe". Which could indicates possible persistence

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\notepad++\\plugins\\')) AND endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.dll')) AND NOT (endswith(lower(actor.process.name), lower('\\notepad++\\updater\\gup.exe')) OR startswith(lower(actor.process.name), lower('c:\\users\\')) AND contains(lower(actor.process.name), lower('\\appdata\\local\\temp\\')) AND (endswith(lower(actor.process.name), lower('\\target.exe')) OR endswith(lower(actor.process.name), lower('installer.x64.exe')))))

output.summary: Detects creation of new ".dll" files inside the plugins directory of a notepad++ installation by a process other than "gup.exe". Which could indicates possible persistence

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Possible FPs during first installation of Notepad++ 2. Legitimate use of custom plugins by users in order to enhance notepad++ functionalities Reference: https://pentestlab.blog/2022/02/14/persistence-notepad-plugins/
